operation.descriptionCdata:
143f33ad-9965-44f3-b590-35e31d5a6018.description=This operation takes a reference to JSON (in the form of a string) and runs a specified JSON Path query on it. It returns the results as a JSON Object. 

Inputs\:
 json - The JSON in the form of a string.
 jsonPathQuery - The JSON Path query to run. See details and examples in the Notes section below.

Results\:
 returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the resulted JSON from the given path.

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
 failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1.Query syntax\:
JSONPath 		Description
------------ ------------- 
$ 		The root object/element
@ 		The current object/element
. or [] 		Child operator
n/a 		Parent operator
.. 		Recursive descent. JSONPath borrows this syntax from E4X.
* 		Wildcard. All objects/elements regardless of their names.
n/a 		Attribute access. JSON structures do not have attributes.
[] 		Subscript operator. XPath uses it to iterate over element collections and for predicates. In JSON it is the native array operator.
[,] 		Union operator in XPath results in a combination of node sets. JSONPath allows alternate names or array indices as a set.
[start\:end\:step] 	Array slice operator borrowed from ES4.
?() 		Applies a filter (script) expression.
() 		Sript expression, using the underlying script engine.

2.Examples\:
The examples below use the following JSON string value\:
{
 "store"\: {
 "book"\: [
 {
 "category"\: "reference",
 "author"\: "Nigel Rees",
 "title"\: "Sayings of the Century",
 "price"\: 8.95
 },
 {
 "category"\: "fiction",
 "author"\: "Evelyn Waugh",
 "title"\: "Sword of Honour",
 "price"\: 12.99
 },
 {
 "category"\: "fiction",
 "author"\: "Herman Melville",
 "title"\: "Moby Dick",
 "isbn"\: "0-553-21311-3",
 "price"\: 8.99
 },
 {
 "category"\: "fiction",
 "author"\: "J. R. R. Tolkien",
 "title"\: "The Lord of the Rings",
 "isbn"\: "0-395-19395-8",
 "price"\: 22.99
 }
 ],
 "bicycle"\: {
 "color"\: "red",
 "price"\: null
 }
 },
 "expensive"\: "10"
}

JSONPath 			Result
------------ ---------
$.store.book[*].author 		The authors of all books in the store
$...author 			All authors\: ["Nigel Rees","Evelyn Waugh","Herman Melville","J. R. R. Tolkien"]
$.store.* 			All items in store, which are some books and a red bicycle.
$.store..price 		The price of everything in the store
$..book[2] 			The third book
$..book[(@.length-1)] or $..book[-1\:] 	The last book in order
$..book[0,1] or $..book[\:2] 	The first two books
$..book[?(@.isbn)] 		Filter all books with isbn number
$..book[?(@.price<10)] 		Filter all books wholse price is less than 10
$..* 			All Elements in XML document. All members of JSON structure. 
$.store.book[0]		Returns the details of the first book\: reference,Nigel Rees,Sayings of the Century,8.95
$.store.bicycle			Returns the details of the bicycle including null in JSON format\: {"color"\:"red","price"\:null}
operation.name: JSON Path
